title: Kenai Fjords National Park: Hiking
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things to Do     Hiking               Hiking         Hiking to the Harding Icefield gives great views of Exit Glacier below. NPS Photo  Maintain Trails  The only maintained trails in Kenai Fjords National Park are those in the Exit Glacier Area. These include:  Several short trails on the valley floor. The Harding Icefield Trail.    Backcountry Hiking Most of the backcountry is trail-less wilderness. Off-trail hiking is not recommended.The terrain is steep and rugged, and often requires scrambling through dense vegetation.   Nearby Attractions There is also hiking within the lands of many of our neighbors.           Trail map of the Exit Glacier area.
